body:
do you know how to set rounded corners?
thanks.

@tuchangwei roundedness is a property of a rectangle. That works.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1307745/33220652-d5a424da-d0fe-11e7-86d8-de18894a9cf7.png)

@MrNinja Yes, you can use an [OutlineProvider](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/View.html#setOutlineProvider(android.view.ViewOutlineProvider)) on which you can [setRoundedRect](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/Outline#setRoundRect(android.graphics.Rect,%20float))

Thank you for your suggest. Let me read more about it.

Edit: I apply this suggestion into my project and It work. Thank you a lot.

issue.title: Round-able LottieAnimationView request

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
According `lottie-ios` and `lottie-web`, developer could update the corner of `LottieAnimationView` by default. In Android application, I have to create a new `View` to apply the same effect.

I have an `ImageView` which have a rounded shape for display user's avatar (feature image). However, this `ImageView` could be settled by any animations shape from user. Could you help me by adding some properties which  support rounding `LottieAnimationView`?

issue.title: Added support for rounded corners on shapes and rects

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Ellipsis and Polystars are not supported but they have their own roundedness properties.

Fixes #106

issue.title: Track matte (alpha) not working on Android

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
**Checklist**

1. My animation doesn't use any [unsupported features](http://airbnb.io/lottie/#/supported-features).

Alpha matte seems to be a supported feature on Android

2. I know what part of my animation doesn't work.

Bottom clipping, see bug description for more details

3. I have created a simplified version of my animation

The animation is quite simple
 
4. I have attached the AEP file (as a zip file so it can be attached) that only has the part of the animation that doesn't work.

[Rating Lottie Issue.aep.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/7152815/Rating.Lottie.Issue.aep.zip)


**Describe the bug**
The animation should have a round mask at the bottom, which is also visible in LottieFiles preview on web: https://lottiefiles.com/76538-thumbs-up-masked
But when we try the Android export, the bottom is not clipped anymore:
[thumbs_up_keyframes.json.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/7152787/thumbs_up_keyframes.json.zip)

**What version of Lottie did you test this on?**
3.4.2 and 4.1.0

**What version of Android did you test this on?**
Android 11

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Play the animation.
You can also open it in the LottieFiles / Lottie app from the play store, it has the same issue

**Screenshots**

![Screen Shot 2021-09-13 at 10 43 27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3629582/133052686-52fb7674-3d9a-4e9d-8a1c-e11cf48f502f.png)
